items.title: Kristi Noem Recommends New Travel Ban After National Guard Shooting
items.summary: Kristi Noem, the secretary of homeland security, equated immigrants to “foreign invaders” as she called for an expanded travel ban. President Trump reposted her statement.

items.title: As Trump Deepens Immigration Crackdown, Exceptions Disappear for Afghans and Others
items.summary: President Trump’s latest changes to the immigration system affect communities that traditionally have been considered special cases.

items.title: Trump Administration Revokes Licenses of Thousands of Training Centers for Truckers
items.summary: The move, and threats of thousands more revocations, comes as the administration has increased its criticism of the trucking industry over noncitizen drivers’ obtaining commercial licenses.

items.title: Trump’s Crackdown in Wake of Shooting Blocks Legal Pathways for Migrants
items.summary: The new measures represent some of the most significant changes to immigration policy since President Trump returned to the White House.

items.title: Hegseth Ordered Lethal Boat Strike but Not the Killing of Survivors, Officials Say
items.summary: Amid talk of war crimes, the details and precise sequence of a Sept. 2 attack on a boat in the Caribbean are facing intensifying scrutiny.

items.title: Reginald T. Jackson, A.M.E. Bishop With Political Power, Dies at 71
items.summary: Influential up and down the Eastern Seaboard, he was part of a long tradition among Black clergy of fighting bias and getting out the vote. “No vote, no clout,” he’d say.

items.title: Trump discusses Venezuela with advisers as Hegseth distances himself from second strike on suspected drug boat –as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/01/trump-administration-news-update-today">Trump news at a glance: tensions with Venezuela rise following president’s reported ultimatum to Maduro</a></p></li></ul><p>The president has picked up where he left off before Thanksgiving, when it comes to his anger at the six Democratic lawmakers who took part in a video urging service members to “refuse illegal orders”.</p><p>A reminder, that Trump initially went on a Truth Social tirade, accusing the members of Congress (all of whom are veterans or former intelligence officials) of sedition, adding that their actions are “punishable by death”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/dec/01/donald-trump-pete-hegseth-caribbean-boats-venezuela-immigration-us-politics-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump news at a glance: tensions with Venezuela rise following president’s reported ultimatum to Maduro
items.summary: <p>Trump reportedly had a ‘blunt message’ for Venezuelan president: leave power and your country immediately – key US politics stories from 1 December at a glance</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> reportedly had a blunt message for Venezuelan president <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/nicolas-maduro">Nicolás Maduro</a>: leave power – and your country – immediately.</p><p>Sources <a href="https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/venezuela/article313261442.html#storylink=cpy">told the Miami Herald</a> the US president had a phone call with his South American counterpart, who is the focus of a four-month pressure campaign in which Trump has ordered a major naval deployment off Venezuela’s northern coast.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/01/trump-administration-news-update-today">Continue reading...</a>
